DOC.brief_title: Walking Therapy In Hemiparetic Stroke Patients Using Robotic-Assisted Treadmill Training
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects enrol study randomly assign one 2 group . The first group receive one hour conventional gait training , consist low extremity strengthen exercise , stretch , full weight bear walk tolerate , appropriate physical assistance therapist . The second group receive walk therapy use Lokomat , special treadmill work conjunction 2 light-weight robotic arm assist subject move leg try walk treadmill . Some subject â€™ body-weight support use harness . During Lokomat training session , subject receive feedback walking performance computer monitor help walk . Both group train 8-10 week , 3 time per week , 1 hour training session ( 24 total session ) . Resources transportation National Rehabilitation Hospital provide study participant .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion : Unilateral brain lesion . Within 6 month poststroke . Receiving therapy target function low limb . Demonstration hemiparesis ( motor dysfunction lower limb ) . Able walk 5 meter without therapist assistance ( walk device ) . Able follow command protocol . Exclusion : Significant cognitive communication impairment . Uncontrolled hypertension . Uncontrolled diabetes . Clinical depression .
